greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numerators in expansion of (1-x)^(-5/2).
link: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
formula: a(n) = denominator((3/2)*Integral_{x=0..1} x^n*sqrt(1-x) dt), where the integral is sqrt(Pi)*n!/Gamma(n+5/2) = n!/( (n+3/2)*(n+1/2)*(n-1/2)*...*(1/2)). - Roland Groux, Feb 23 2011
mathematica: Numerator[CoefficientList[Series[(1-x)^(-5/2),{x,0,30}],x]] (* or *) Numerator[Table[(4n^2+8n+3)/3 Binomial[2n,n]/4^n,{n,0,30}]] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Oct 15 2011 *)
xref: Cf. A161200 Numerators in expansion of (1-x)^(3/2).
A161198 triangle related to the series expansions of (1-x)^((-1-2*n)/2) for all values of n.
A046161 gives the denominators of the series expansions of (1-x)^(-5/2).
results.author: _Johannes W. Meijer_, Jun 08 2009
